result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

9:14 AM Defendant Jeffrey Anthony Charles appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John Joseph Leunig appeared by video for Jeffrey Anthony Charles.  Attorney Rebecca L Sommers appeared by video for Department of Justice. Attorney Leunig acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status in 2 to 3 months, indicates large amount of discovery. State has no objection. Court sets status conference.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.

Adjustment Number: 22A 108301,
Payable Number: 148831,
Receipt Number: 22R 007589,
Amount: $20.00
Notice of Appearance as Co-Counsel AAG Sommers
No contact with Victim #1 or minors. Not leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to law enforcement in Douglas County within 24 hours of release from custody.

1:35 PM Defendant Jeffrey Anthony Charles appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Hoffman making a special appearance today as defendant does not qualify. Attorney Hoffman waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court quashes warrant. State requests $100,000 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim #1 and minors. Not leave the State of Wisconsin and surrender passport to law enforcement. Defendant does not have local ties to the area. Defendant has one prior 1997 in Iowa for 3rd degree sexual assault. Court questions State if the defendant has a passport. Attorney Hoffman states defendant has resided at address for last 15 years in Danbury and his spouse lives there as well. Defendant could post $1,000 cash bail. Defendant states he does possess a passport. Court orders $500,000 with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or minors. Not leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to law enforcement in Douglas County within 24 hours of release from custody.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
